abstract: Social Security recipients will get 3.6 percent increase in benefits in 2012 to help keep up with inflation, first such cost-of-living adjustment in three years.
snippet: A cost-of-living increase, the first in three years, will raise the average monthly payment to $1,229.
lead_paragraph: A cost-of-living increase, the first in three years, will raise the average monthly payment to $1,229.

headline.main: U.S. Benefits for Retirees to Rise 3.6% Next Year
headline.print_headline: U.S. Benefits For Retirees To Rise 3.6% Next Year
